title: NeRF-3DTalker: Neural Radiance Field with 3D Prior Aided Audio Disentanglement for Talking Head Synthesis
author: Xiaoxing Liu (Tianjin University), Zhilei Liu (Tianjin University), Chongke Bi (Tianjin University)
relevance_why: This paper employs 3D morphable models and audio processing techniques which could be relevant to Haohe's research in audio generation and enhancement, particularly in understanding how to better align audio and visual data.
background: This paper presents a method for synthesizing realistic talking head videos that are synchronized with audio, effectively mapping audio features to visual representations.
contribution: NeRF-3DTalker introduces 3D prior information and a novel audio disentanglement module to solve the problem of blurry facial images in talking head synthesis, achieving improved realism and lip synchronization.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods mainly focused on frontal faces and struggled with novel view synthesis and effective lip-syncing.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work combines 3D morphable models and an audio disentanglement approach, improving image quality and synchronization by aligning acoustic features with 3D visual representations.

key_innovation: The method uniquely integrates 3D facial priors and efficiently disentangles audio features to enhance the realism of generated talking heads from multiple views.
real_world_impact: This technology can greatly benefit applications in entertainment, virtual reality, and communication by enabling more realistic avatar representations, potentially enhancing user engagement in digital interactions.

new_terms.3D Morphable Model (3DMM): **3D Morphable Model (3DMM)** is a statistical model that represents 3D shapes and appearances of faces based on variations in identity and expression.
